projectsData.title: Lyft Bikes API Experiment
projectsData.description: I reverse engineered Lyft Bikes API to add remote-unlock functionality, and in the process discovered (and disclosed) a vulnerability.

projectsData.title: Deterministic Minesweeper
projectsData.description: Version of Minesweeper that only generates maps that can be solved without guessing. (You can play it!)

projectsData.title: Course Registration Tool
projectsData.description: SMS-based service that allowed students to request to be notified when a spot opens up in a capped class.

projectsData.title: Grading Infrastructure
projectsData.description: I designed and built a generic auto-grading system for a new course at Brown, along with a continuous deveopment infrastructure.

projectsData.title: Liar's Dice AI
projectsData.description: Bayesian agent capable of beating humans in the game of Liar's Dice. It was later used to train a deep reinforcement learning model.

projectsData.title: Mastermind AI
projectsData.description: Near-optimal agent optimized to play and win faster than humans. Currently working on abstracting this to a generic state-discovery agent for games like Guess Who and Clue.

projectsData.title: Personal Website
projectsData.description: I designed and built this personal website, and set up a static deployment strategy on Github Pages using git subtrees.

projectsData.title: Text to Messenger Tool
projectsData.description: Nifty tool that forwards SMS to my Messenger so I could receieve 2FA texts while away from the US.

projectsData.title: Weenix OS
projectsData.description: Unix-like operating system with processes, threads, device drivers, a virtual filesystem, S5FS, and virtual memory management.

bullets: Led development of data delivery validation framework, that bolstered security and deployment confidence.
Proposed and wrote Python script to modularize hundreds of test cases, cutting review times from days to minutes.
Gained experience developing with Scala’s and Twitter’s Libraries (Futures, Modules, Dependency Injection, etc).
Led team of 12 in a customer-facing redesign to Twitter Developer Portal, revamping dashboard and billing flow.
Held inception meeting with 15 engineers, producing 40 tickets, and then wrote entire technical design document.
Spent a week migrating 22 website routes to a new layouts pattern, writing over 500 lines of React in 11 files.
Led development of data delivery validation framework, that bolstered security and deployment confidence.
